div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 210 Carystus ?, Euboea, 1930 (290) Burial: c. 200 B.C. (T) Contents: 28+ AR (originally 90?) Boeotia: 1 dr. (as BMC 78) Carystus: 5 didr. (as Traité pl. 196, 4-5, 15) 6 didr. (royal hd.) ANS 1967.152.259 ANS 1967.152.252 ANS 1944.100.20280 ANS 1978.82.43 Euboean League: 1 didr. (as Traité pl. 197, 19) Andros: 1 didr. Naxos: 3 didr. Paros: 4 tetradr. HAM 1.1965.1966 ANS 1967.152.285 1 didr. 4 dr. (as BMC 13 [1]; 14-15 [2]; same but with ΠΑΡΙ ΘΟϒΡΙ in wreath [1]) Tenos: 1 tetradr. 1 didr. (as BMC 7) Disposition: New York 4 (3 Carystus with hd., 1 Paros tetradr. with ΑΝΑΞΙΚ); Boston 1 (Brett 1293); Athens 1 (Carystus with hd.); M. Wallace, To- ronto 1 (ex Naville July 3, 1933, 1173) ; Naville July 3, 1933, 1305, 1309-13, 1315; Cahn Oct. 14, 1931, 331 Record in ANS incl. casts of 4 dr. of Paros and didr. of Naxos (as Naville 1309 but with ΚΡΗΘΕ) said by Ravel to be from this hd. Wallace, Essays Robinson, p. 205, adds to Noe 290 and suggests that this lot and no. 215 below may be the same bd.
